document.chunk: Russophobic sentiments have entered UK foreign policy - Russian ministry

MOSCOW. July 16 (Interfax) - The British Foreign Office's decision taken in relation to businessman Andrei Lugovoi's case indicates that Russophobic sentiments in the UK have entered the country's foreign policy.

"The decision taken by London today confirms a flare-up in Russophobic sentiments in British society and political circles, which have recently spread to its foreign policy," the Russian Foreign Ministry said in a statement on Monday.
